subject: Gardening
title: Kew Gardens and Empire
description: A fast breakdown of Kew Gardens and Empire for builders.

hook.text: Kew Gardens wasn't just a pretty park. It was the nerve center of the British Empire's plant network.

buildup.text: Founded in 1759, Kew collected plants from every corner of the empire and catalogued them.

discovery.text: Kew scientists decided which crops grew whereâ€”moving rubber to Malaya, cinchona to India for quinine.

twist.text: Colonial botany enriched Britain but devastated local ecosystems and displaced indigenous farming.

climax.text: Today Kew holds the world's largest seed bank and leads global conservationâ€”a complicated redemption arc.

punchline.text: Empire's botanical weapon became conservation's HQ.

quiz.question: What role did Kew Gardens play in the British Empire?
options: It served as a military training ground disguised as a garden
It was purely an aristocratic pleasure garden
It coordinated the movement of economically valuable plants across colonies
